block.p: Ellen Catherine Hopkins and Mario Jesus Suarez-Murias were married yesterday. The Rev. John A. Boehning performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More in New York.

The bride is a placement director at Kelly Law Registry in New York, a company that recruits lawyers and paralegals. She graduated from Northwestern University and Brooklyn Law School. Her father, James D. Hopkins of Tucson, is an owner and the chief executive of Chicago Staffing Services in Chicago and Gold Star Staffing in Phoenix. Her mother, Carol Stutz Hopkins of Evanston, Ill., retired from Loyola Academy in Wilmette, Ill., where she was the chairwoman of the special education department. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.

Her father, James D. Hopkins of Tucson, is an owner and the chief executive of Chicago Staffing Services in Chicago and Gold Star Staffing in Phoenix. Her mother, Carol Stutz Hopkins of Evanston, Ill., retired from Loyola Academy in Wilmette, Ill., where she was the chairwoman of the special education department. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.

The bridegroom, known professionally as Mario J. Suarez, is a partner in the New York office of Morgan, Lewis & Bockius, a law firm. He graduated from Hunter College and the Fordham University School of Law. He is a director of United Neighborhood Houses of New York and of the Broadway Association, a theater district organization.

He is the son of Ada S. Mesa of New York and the late Mario J. Suarez-Murias. His mother retired from Hearst Publications in New York, where she was the billing manager for Motor Boating and Sailing magazine. His father was until 1959 the executive assistant to the president of the Cuban operations of Pan American World Airways in Havana. The bridegroom's grandfather, the late Trinidad Suarez-Murias, was an owner of La Corona Cigar Company in Havana.
